Prerequisite: Aberration, dragon, plant, or undead type, or grippli, half-undead, reptilian, or vishkanya subtype; Benefit: Members of this race gain the following extraordinary ability: A number of times per day equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum 1/day), a member of this race can envenom a weapon that it wields with its toxic saliva or blood (using blood requires the creature to be injured when it uses this ability). Applying venom in this way is a swift action. When you take this trait, choose one of the following venoms.

Life-Stealing Venom: Injury; save Fort DC 10 + 1/2 the user's Hit Dice + the user's Constitution modifier; frequency 1/round for 6 rounds; effect 1 Con; cure 1 save.

Paralytic Venom: Injury; save Fort DC 10 + the 1/2 user's Hit Dice + the user's Constitution modifier; frequency 1/round for 6 rounds; effect 1d2 Dex; cure 1 save.

Weakening Venom: Injury; save Fort DC 10 + 1/2 the user's Hit Dice + the user's Constitution modifier; frequency 1/round for 6 rounds; effect 1d2 Str; cure 1 save.
sections.name: Toxic
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Toxic

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Choose up to two weapons, or one weapon and a racial weapon group. When choosing a racial weapon group, you must choose a group that includes the same name as one of your subtypes. Members of this race are proficient with those weapons. For the purposes of weapon familiarity, all bows are considered one weapon. Special: This trait can be taken up to two times. The second time it is taken, the race becomes proficient with another two weapons or one weapon and a racial weapon group.
sections.name: Weapon Familiarity

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls and a +2 dodge bonus to AC and on saving throws against the extraordinary, supernatural, and spell-like abilities of dragons. In addition, they gain a +2 racial bonus on Knowledge (arcana) checks to identify dragons and can make such checks untrained.
sections.name: Wyrmscourged
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Wyrmscourged

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race receive two claw attacks. These are primary natural attacks. The damage is based on the creature's size .
sections.name: Claws
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Claws

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Once per day, whenever a member of this race takes damage, it flies into a frenzy for 1 minute, gaining a +2 racial bonus to Constitution and Strength, but a –2 penalty to AC.
sections.name: Frenzy
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Frenzy

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race gain the following supernatural ability: Creatures within 30 feet of a member of this race that meet its gaze must succeed at a Will saving throw (DC 10 + the 1/2 user's character level + the user's Charisma modifier) or stand paralyzed in fear for 1 round. This is a mind-affecting fear effect. A target that successfully saves cannot be affected by the user's frightful gaze for 24 hours.
sections.name: Frightful Gaze
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Frightful Gaze

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Pick one of the following natural attacks: gore, hoof (if the race has hooves), slam, talons, or wings (if the race has flight). Members of this race receive one natural attack of the chosen type. Gore, slam, and talons are primary natural attacks, while hoof and wings are secondary natural attacks. The damage is based on the creature's size . Special: This trait can be taken multiple times. Each time, pick a different natural attack.
sections.name: Natural Attack
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Natural Attack

sections.body: Prerequisite: Large size; Benefit: Members of this race have a reach of 10 feet.
sections.name: Reach
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Reach

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race are trained from birth in swordplay, and as a result are automatically proficient with swordlike weapons (including bastard swords, daggers, elven curve blades, falchions, greatswords, kukris, longswords, punching daggers, rapiers, scimitars, short swords, and two-bladed swords).
sections.name: Swordtrained
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Swordtrained

sections.body: Prerequisite: Slapping tail trait; Benefit: When a member of this race hits with its slapping tail, it can make a trip attack as a free action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
sections.name: Tripping Tail
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Tripping Tail

sections.body: Prerequisite: Outsider (native) with ties to an elemental plane; Benefit: Pick one of the following energy types that corresponds to the plane the race has ties to: acid (earth), cold (water), electricity (air), or fire (fire). Members of this race deal 1d6 points of energy damage of the selected type whenever they strike a foe with a natural attack, unarmed strike, or melee weapon.
sections.name: Elemental Weapons
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Monstrous Traits/Elemental Weapons

sections.body: Prerequisite: Natural attack trait; Benefit: Select one of the race's natural attacks. Whenever a member of this race charges, it deals twice the number of damage dice with the selected natural attack plus 1-1/2 times its Strength bonus.
sections.name: Powerful Charge
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Monstrous Traits/Powerful Charge

sections.body: Prerequisite: Large size; Benefit: Members of this race are accomplished rock throwers and gain a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls with thrown rocks. A member of this race can hurl rocks up to two categories smaller than its size. A "rock" is any large, bulky, and relatively regularly shaped object made of any material with a hardness of at least 5. A thrown rock has a range increment of 120 feet. The creature can hurl the rock up to five rage increments. Damage from a thrown rock is 2d6 plus 1-1/2 times the throwing creature's Strength bonus.
sections.name: Rock Throwing
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Offense Racial Traits/Monstrous Traits/Rock Throwing

sections.name: Offense Racial Traits

sections.body: All races start with normal vision. The following traits augment their vision or otherwise enhance their senses.

Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race have a natural ability to sniff out carrion. This functions like the scent ability, but only for corpses and badly wounded creatures (creatures with 25% or fewer hit points).
sections.name: Carrion Sense
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Senses Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Carrion Sense

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race can see in the dark up to 60 feet.
sections.name: Darkvision 60 Feet
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Senses Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Darkvision 60 Feet

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race can see in the dark up to 120 feet.
sections.name: Darkvision 120 Feet
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Senses Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Darkvision 120 Feet

sections.body: Prerequisite: Amphibious racial trait; Benefit: Members of this race are specially adapted to the lightless depths of the oceans, but not to air-filled environments. They can see in the dark up to 120 feet while underwater, but do not gain this benefit out of water.
sections.name: Deepsight
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Senses Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Deepsight

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race can see twice as far as a race with normal vision in conditions of dim light.
sections.name: Low-Light Vision

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race have darkvision 90 feet; however, they are automatically dazzled in bright light and take a –2 penalty on saving throws against effects with the light descriptor.
sections.name: Minesight
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Senses Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Minesight

sections.body: Prerequisite: Outsider (native) with ties to the Plane of Water or amphibious racial trait; Benefit: Members of this race can sense vibrations in water, granting them blindsense 30 feet against creatures that are touching the same body of water.
sections.name: Water Sense
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Senses Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Water Sense

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race gain the scent ability .
sections.name: Scent
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Senses Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Scent

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race can see perfectly in darkness of any kind, including that created by spells such as deeper darkness.
sections.name: See in Darkness
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Senses Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/See in Darkness

sections.body:
Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race have some way of seeing all around them, granting them a +4 racial bonus on Perception checks and making them immune to flanking.

Blindsense 30 Feet (4 RP): Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Using nonvisual senses such as acute smell or hearing, members of this race notice things they cannot see. Members of this race usually do not need to make Perception checks to pinpoint the location of a creature within 30 feet, provided they have line of effect to that creature. A creature that members of this race cannot see still has total concealment against individuals with blindsense, and members of this race still have the normal miss chance when attacking creatures that have concealment. Visibility still affects the movement of members of this race. Members of this race are still denied their Dexterity bonus to AC against attacks from creatures they cannot see.
sections.name: All-Around Vision
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Senses Racial Traits/Monstrous Traits/All-Around Vision

sections.name: Senses Racial Traits

sections.body: The following racial traits apply weaknesses to members of the race. All weakness racial traits cost negative RP, which means they subtract from a race's total RP spent for the purposes of meeting the race's power level restrictions.

Prerequisite: Darkvision or see in darkness trait; Weakness: Abrupt exposure to bright light blinds members of this race for 1 round; on subsequent rounds, they are dazzled as long as they remain in the affected area.
sections.name: Light Blindness
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Weakness Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Light Blindness

sections.body: Prerequisite: Darkvision; Weakness: Members of this race are dazzled as long as they remain in an area of bright light.
sections.name: Light Sensitivity
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Weakness Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Light Sensitivity

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Weakness: A member of this race is alive, but reacts to positive and negative energy as if it were undead—positive energy harms it, while negative energy heals it.
sections.name: Negative Energy Affinity
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Weakness Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Negative Energy Affinity

sections.body: Prerequisite: Half-undead subtype or undead type; Weakness: A raise dead spell cast on a member of this race can destroy it (Will negates). Using the spell in this way does not require a material component.
sections.name: Resurrection Vulnerability
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Weakness Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Resurrection Vulnerability

sections.body: Prerequisite: Native to the Darklands or the Plane of Shadow; Weakness: Members of this race take 1 point of Constitution damage after every hour they are exposed to sunlight.
sections.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Weakness Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Vulnerable to Sunlight

sections.body: Prerequisite: Outsider (native) with ties to an elemental plane; Weakness: Pick one of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. Members of this race have vulnerability to the chosen energy type. They cannot posses any racial trait that grants them resistance or immunity to this energy type. Special: This trait can be taken multiple times. Each time it is taken, choose a different energy type. If a race has vulnerability to fire and immunity to cold, it gains the cold subtype. If a race has vulnerability to cold and immunity to fire, it gains the fire subtype.
sections.name: Elemental Vulnerability
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Weakness Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Elemental Vulnerability

sections.body: Prerequisite: Half-undead subtype or undead type; Weakness: Members of this race are powerless in natural sunlight (this does not include light created by effects such as a daylight spell). A member of this race caught in natural sunlight cannot attack and is staggered.
sections.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Weakness Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Sunlight Powerlessness

sections.name: Weakness Racial Traits

sections.body: This category covers various traits that other categories do not, which can augment your race in a number of different ways.
Prerequisite: Swim racial trait; Benefit: Members of this race are amphibious and can breathe both air and water.
sections.name: Amphibious
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Amphibious

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: In campaigns that use the optional hero point system , each time a member of this race gains a level, it gains 2 hero points instead of 1. If it takes the Blood of Heroes feat, it gains 3 hero points each level instead of 2.
sections.name: Heroic
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Heroic

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race can hold their breath for a number of rounds equal to four times their Constitution score before risking drowning or suffocating.
sections.name: Hold Breath
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Hold Breath

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race gain the following supernatural ability: Once per day as an immediate action, a member of this race can treat positive and negative energies as if it were an undead creature, taking damage from positive energy and healing damage from negative energy. This ability lasts for 1 minute once activated.
sections.name: Light and Dark
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Light and Dark

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race choose two favored classes at 1st level and gain +1 hit points or +1 skill rank whenever they take a level in either of those classes.
sections.name: Multitalented
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Multitalented

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race have a long, flexible tail that can be used to carry objects. They cannot wield weapons with their tails, but they can retrieve small, stowed objects carried on their persons as a swift action.
sections.name: Prehensile Tail
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Prehensile Tail

sections.body: Prerequisite: Ratfolk subtype; Benefit: Members of this race gain a +4 bonus on Handle Animal checks made to influence rodents.
sections.name: Rodent Empathy
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Rodent Empathy

sections.body: Prerequisite: Plant type; Benefit: Members of this race have the ability to converse with plants as if subject to a continual speak with plants spell.
sections.name: Treespeech
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Standard Traits/Treespeech

sections.body: Prerequisites: Any type except humanoid, Large size; Benefit: Members of this race have a small group of appendages that are useful for little more than to aid in grappling. Members of this race gain Improved Grapple as a bonus feat, and can maintain a grapple and still make attacks with their main appendages.
sections.name: Grabbing Appendages
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Advanced Traits/Grabbing Appendages

sections.body: Prerequisites: None; Benefit: Members of this race possess three arms. A member of this race can wield multiple weapons, but only one hand is its primary hand, and all others are off hands. It can also use its hands for other purposes that require free hands. Special: This trait can be taken up to twice. When it is taken a second time, the race gains a fourth arm.
sections.name: Multi-Armed
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Monstrous Traits/Multi-Armed

sections.body: Prerequisites: Any type except humanoid, Large size, normal speed; Benefit: Members of this race possess four legs and two arms, granting them a +4 racial bonus to CMD against trip attempts and a +10 foot bonus to their base speed. In addition, members of this race use weapons and armor as if they were Medium (instead of Large). Special: The number of legs can be increased by 2 for each additional 1 RP spent. Each such increase grants an additional +4 racial bonus to CMD against trip attempts, but no other bonus.
sections.name: Quadruped
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Other Racial Traits/Monstrous Traits/Quadruped

sections.name: Other Racial Traits

sections.body: Creating a race with more than two legs adversely affects that race's ability to use standard feet slot magic items. The best way to deal with this is to create variant magic item versions of the various boots, shoes, and slippers that can be worn by this race. Allow members of these races to find ankle bracelets of speed or horseshoes of spider climb that act just like their traditional magic item counterparts, but fit the new race's form.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Race Guide/Rules/Race Builder/Racial Traits/Quadrupeds and Magic Item Slots
sections.name: Quadrupeds and Magic Item Slots
